yes use xMing...its the best
xMing > all others
it does lack session features that you might be used to with vnc/screen or freenx
but then again...it doesnt if you use it right
xMing is just a xserver for windows...so you setup putty for x forwarding, then you ssh to your ubuntu machine..and then any gui based prog you run will appear on your windows machine
faced with a sysadmin that wouldnt let me install ubuntu on 24 machines in awebdev envrioment easiest way for me to get gedit on all those machines was to use xming on them
